Steps.Procedure: Used unicode right-to-left override (RTLO) character to obfuscate file name rcs.3aka3.doc (originally cod.3aka.scr)
Steps.Criteria: Evidence of the right-to-left override character (U+202E) in the rcs.3aka.doc process ​OR the original filename (cod.3aka.scr)

Detections.DetectionNote: A Technique alert detection (info severity) called "Right-to-Left Override" was generated due a process event with RTLO.
An MSSP detection occurred containing evidence of the original filename: cod.3aka.scr.
Telemetry showed the right-to-left override character (U+202E) in rcs.3aka.doc and the original filename.

Steps.Procedure: Masqueraded a Chrome password dump tool as accesscheck.exe, a legitimate Sysinternals tool
Steps.Criteria: Evidence that accesschk.exe is not the legitimate Sysinternals tool

Detections.DetectionNote: An MSSP detection for Masquerading occurred containing evidence that accesschk.exe is not the legitimate Sysinternals tool.
Telemetry showed that accesschk.exe is not the legitimate Sysinternals tool by comparing the hashes.

Telemetry showed the PowerShell gwmi query for Win32_Process.

Telemetry showed script block with commands to timestomp kxwn.lock.
